comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: This photograph shows Company C of the 110th Pennsylvania Infantry. The men wear the lozenge of the III Corps on their forage caps. The soldier to the immediate right of the officer is carrying a Model 1855 rifle musket, while his comrade (5th man to the right of the officer) carries a British-made Enfield.

comment.author: 56237625@N07
comment._content: Agreed. The 6th Maine served in the 4th and 6th Corps. Their badges were a triangle and a cross.
